location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.32 of 1854 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the Wahabee [Wahhābī] presence on the Arab coast. Kemball reports that he has received intelligence from the Native Agent at Sharjah, of which an English translation is enclosed with his letter, dated 29 December 1853 (folio 175), stating that the Wahhabi commander Abdullah bin Fysul [‘Abdullāh bin Fayṣa] has dparted from Brymee [Al Buraymī], leaving one of his lieutenants and a reduced forced in charge.
